item.text: “‘This is the law of the guilt offering. It is most holy.

In the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> they <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughter</st> the <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st> they must <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughter</st> the <st data-num="0817" class="">guilt offering</st>, and the officiating priest<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="02236" class="">splash</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar’s</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">sides</st>.

Then the one making the offering<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="07126" class="">present</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> its <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st>: the <st data-num="0451" class="">fatty tail</st>, the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">covering</st> the <st data-num="07130" class="">entrails</st>,

the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03629" class="">kidneys</st> and the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> their <st data-num="03689" class="">sinews</st>, and the <st data-num="03508" class="">protruding lobe</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03516" class="">liver</st> (which he must <st data-num="05493" class="">remove</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">along with</st> the <st data-num="03629">kidneys</st>).<n id="1" />
Then the priest must offer them up in smoke on the altar as a gift to the Lord. It is a guilt offering.

<st data-num="03605" class="">Any</st> <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st> among the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it. It must be <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st> in a <st data-num="06918" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st>. <st data-num="01931" class="">It</st> is <st data-num="06944" class="">most</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st>.<n id="1" />
The law is the same for the sin offering and the guilt offering; it belongs to the priest who makes atonement with it.
“‘As for the priest who presents someone’s burnt offering, the hide of that burnt offering which he presented belongs to him.

<st data-num="03605" class="">Every</st> <st data-num="04503" class="">grain offering</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is <st data-num="0644" class="">baked</st> in the <st data-num="08574" class="">oven</st> or<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> in the <st data-num="04802" class="">pan</st><n id="2" /> or <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04227" class="">griddle</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">belongs</st> to the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> who <st data-num="07126" class="">presented</st> it.
Every grain offering, whether mixed with olive oil or dry, belongs to all the sons of Aaron, each one alike.
“‘This is the law of the peace-offering sacrifice which he is to present to the Lord.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> he <st data-num="07126" class="">presents</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">on account of</st> <st data-num="08426" class="">thanksgiving</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">along with</st> the <st data-num="08426" class="">thank-offering</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st> he must <st data-num="07126" class="">present</st> <st data-num="04682" class="">unleavened</st> <st data-num="02471" class="">loaves</st> <st data-num="01101" class="">mixed</st> with <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>, <st data-num="04682" class="">unleavened</st> <st data-num="07550" class="">wafers</st> <st data-num="04886" class="">smeared</st> with <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07246" class="">well-soaked</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="02471" class="">ring-shaped loaves</st> made of <st data-num="05560" class="">choice wheat flour</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="01101" class="">mixed</st> with <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>.

He must <st data-num="07126" class="">present</st> this <st data-num="07133" class="">grain offering</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">in addition to</st> <st data-num="02471" class="">ring-shaped loaves</st> of <st data-num="02557" class="">leavened</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">which regularly accompany</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st> of his <st data-num="08426" class="">thanksgiving</st> <st data-num="08002" class="">peace offering</st>.
He must present one of each kind of grain offering as a contribution offering to the Lord; it belongs to the priest who splashes the blood of the peace offering.
The meat of his thanksgiving peace offering must be eaten on the day of his offering; he must not set any of it aside until morning.
“‘If his offering is a votive or freewill sacrifice, it may be eaten on the day he presents his sacrifice, and also the leftovers from it may be eaten on the next day,

but the <st data-num="03498" class="">leftovers</st> from the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> of the <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st> must be <st data-num="08313" class="">burned up</st> in the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st><n id="1" /> on the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> some of the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> of his <st data-num="08002" class="">peace-offering</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st> is <st data-num="0398" class="">ever</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st> on the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, it will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07521" class="">be accepted</st>; it will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="02803" class="">accounted</st> to the one who <st data-num="07126" class="">presented</st> it since it <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> <st data-num="06292" class="">spoiled</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="05315" class="">person</st> who <st data-num="0398" class="">eats</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it will <st data-num="05375" class="">bear</st> his <st data-num="05771" class="">punishment for iniquity</st>.<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touches</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">anything</st> <st data-num="02931" class="">ceremonially unclean</st><n id="1" /> must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten;</st> it must be <st data-num="08313" class="">burned up</st> in the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st>. As for ceremonially clean <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">everyone</st> who is <st data-num="02889" class="">ceremonially clean</st> may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st>.
The person who eats meat from the peace-offering sacrifice which belongs to the Lord while that person’s uncleanness persists will be cut off from his people.

When a person touches anything unclean (whether human uncleanness, or an unclean animal, or an unclean detestable creature) and eats some of the meat of the peace-offering sacrifice which belongs to the Lord, that person will be cut off from his people.’”
Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="01696" class="">Tell</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>, ‘You must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> of an <st data-num="07794" class="">ox</st>, <st data-num="03775" class="">sheep</st>, or <st data-num="05795" class="">goat</st>.

Moreover, the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> of an <st data-num="05038" class="">animal that has died</st> of natural causes<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> of an <st data-num="02966" class="">animal torn by beasts</st> may be <st data-num="06213" class="">used</st> for <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> other <st data-num="04399" class="">purpose</st>,<n id="2" /> but you must <st data-num="0398" class="">certainly</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">never</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it.
If anyone eats fat from the animal from which he presents a gift to the Lord, that person will be cut off from his people.

And you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> of the <st data-num="05775" class="">birds</st> or of the <st data-num="0929" class="">domesticated land animals</st> in <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> of the <st data-num="04186" class="">places where</st> you <st data-num="04186" class="">live</st>.<n id="1" />
Any person who eats any blood—that person will be cut off from his people.’”
Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
“Tell the Israelites, ‘The one who presents his peace-offering sacrifice to the Lord must bring part of his offering to the Lord as his sacrifice.
With his own hands he must bring the Lord’s gifts. He must bring the fat with the breast to wave the breast as a wave offering before the Lord,

and the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="06999" class="">offer</st> the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">up in smoke</st> on the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, but the <st data-num="02373" class="">breast</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">belong</st> to <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>.

The <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> <st data-num="07785" class="">thigh</st> you must <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> as a <st data-num="08641" class="">contribution offering</st><n id="1" /> to the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> from your <st data-num="08002" class="">peace-offering</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st>.

The one from <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> who <st data-num="07126" class="">presents</st> the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> of the <st data-num="08002" class="">peace offering</st> and <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">have</st> the <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> <st data-num="07785" class="">thigh</st> as his <st data-num="04490" class="">share</st>,

for the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the contribution offering I have taken from the Israelites out of their peace-offering sacrifices and have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons from the people of Israel as a perpetual allotted portion.’”
This is the allotment of Aaron and the allotment of his sons from the Lord’s gifts on the day Moses presented them to serve as priests to the Lord.
This is what the Lord commanded to give to them from the Israelites on the day Moses anointed them—a perpetual allotted portion throughout their generations.
This is the law for the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the ordination offering, and the peace-offering sacrifice,
which the Lord commanded Moses on Mount Sinai on the day he commanded the Israelites to present their offerings to the Lord in the desert of Sinai.
